DOC.brief_summary: The midurethral tension-free vaginal tape ( macroporous polypropylene mesh ) procedure well establish technique treat female stress urinary incontinence patient ( hyper ) mobile urethra . Postoperative continence rate achieve 95 % . Currently , several anatomical approach develop investigated simplify minimal invasive technique make safer . While retropubic approach consist passage needle midurethra behind pubic bone cavum retzii , transobturator technique traverse foramina obturatoria . Intraoperative complication like bladder perforation ( 4 % ) treat conservatively , postoperative complication like void dysfunction ( urinary outlet obstruction 16 % urinary retention ) troublesome , impair quality life require occasionally surgical sling release ( transection sling ) . The aim study compare quality life , postoperative voiding dysfunction , success rate tape position retropubic transobturator sling procedure . - Trial surgical intervention
DOC.brief_title: A Comparison Retropubic ( TVT ) With Transobturator Sling Operation Treatment Female Stress Urinary Incontinence Stress Dominated Mixed Urinary Incontinence
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : Urodynamic stress urinary incontinence stress dominate mixed urinary incontinence mobile urethra With without concomitant surgery pelvic organ prolapse With without hysterectomy Exclusion criterion : No informed consent No preoperative urodynamic investigation Mixed urinary incontinence predominant overactive bladder Recurrent stress urinary incontinence sling procedure Begin treatment overactive bladder less month ago non stable condition Pregnancy Desires future childbearing Concomitant incontinence procedure like intravesikal injection Botulinumtoxin Preoperative postvoid residual urinary volume exceed 100cc Coagulopathies
